abstract: Puerto Rico unveils stringent plan to unburden itself of huge debt which would demand at least five years of painful reform, involving service cutbacks; plan calls for restructuring about $47 billion of total $72 billion in bond debt;
lead_paragraph: The plan requires either concessions negotiated from creditors or legislation enacted in San Juan or Washington, suggesting a difficult road ahead.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Lays Out 5-Year Plan for Restructuring Its Debts
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico Unveils Painful Plan for Islanders, and Bond Holders

snippet: The plan requires either concessions negotiated from creditors or legislation enacted in San Juan or Washington, suggesting a difficult road ahead.
